alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 9:23AM CDT until July 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Custer, Canadian, Blaine and Caddo Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Low-lying bottomlands near the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The river stage at 7:00 PM is estimated at 14.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM CDT.
